title: Orfani
text:
Orfani (, formerly Ορφάνιον - Orfanion) is a village and a former municipality in the <a href="Kavala%20%28regional%20unit%29">Kavala regional unit</a>, <a href="East%20Macedonia%20and%20Thrace">East Macedonia and Thrace</a>, <a href="Greece">Greece</a>. Since the 2011 local government reform it is part of the municipality <a href="Pangaio">Pangaio</a>, of which it is a municipal unit (municipal unit of Orfano). The municipal unit has an area of 200.862 km2. The municipal unit has a population of 5,249, and the village of Orfani has 706 inhabitants (2011). The seat of the municipality was <a href="Galipsos">Galipsos</a>.
Called Orfano in the 19th century, the town has been identified with the Byzantine <a href="Chrysopolis%20%28Thrace%29">Chrysopolis</a> in Macedonia.
